item.title: Infosys Q3 Results: Profit rises 11% to Rs 6,806 cr, revenue up 8% - The Economic Times
item.description:
Infosys Q3 Results: Profit rises 11% YoY to Rs 6,806 cr, revenue up 8%

Publication Date: January 12, 2025
Source: ETMarkets.com

Infosys, India's second-largest IT services exporter, has reported an 11% year-on-year growth in consolidated net profit, amounting to Rs 6,806 crore, with operations revenue increasing by 8% to Rs 41,764 crore. The company has raised its revenue guidance for FY25 to 4.5%-5%.

  • Consolidated net profit increased by 11% YoY to Rs 6,806 crore.
  • Revenue from operations rose by 8% YoY to Rs 41,764 crore.
  • Revenue guidance for the fiscal year has been revised to 4.5%-5%.
  • Operating margins expected to be around 20-22% in FY25.
  • Operating profit grew 12% YoY to Rs 8,912 crore.
  • Infosys reported a large deal total contract value of $2.5 billion this quarter.
“Our strong revenue growth in a seasonally weak quarter and broad-based year on year growth reflects the success of our differentiated digital offerings,” said Salil Parekh, CEO and MD of Infosys.

In conclusion, Infosys demonstrated robust financial performance in Q3 FY25 with significant growth across key metrics, positioning itself strongly in the competitive IT landscape.

item.title: SBI share price jumps after announcement of Q3 results 2025 date | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
SBI Share Price Rises on Q3 Results Announcement Date

Publication Date: January 25, 2025 | Source: Live Mint

Shares of State Bank of India (SBI) increased by nearly 2% after the announcement of the date for its quarterly financial results.

  • SBI's Central Board will meet on February 6, 2025, to discuss financial results for Q4 2024.
  • The stock has gained 22.28% over the past year, outpacing both Nifty and Nifty Bank indices.
  • SBI's Q2FY25 net profit rose by 27.92% year-on-year, reaching ₹18,331 crore.
  • Net interest income grew by 5.37% year-on-year, totaling ₹41,620 crore.
  • Current deposit cost stands at 5.03%, an increase from previous quarters.
"The bank's Q2 results were better than expected, driven by non-interest income growth."

The increase in SBI's share price highlights investor confidence ahead of the upcoming results, signaling positive market sentiment.

item.title: National Startup Day 2025: These are the top-10 most valuable unicorns - CNBCTV18
item.description:
National Startup Day 2025: Top 10 Most Valuable Unicorns in India

Publication Date: January 16, 2025 | Source: CNBC-TV18

As India celebrates National Startup Day, this summary presents a look at the top 10 startups that are leading in valuations and showcasing innovation.

  • National Startup Day on January 16 recognizes startups that drive innovation and growth.
  • Top 10 unicorns include giants like Flipkart, PhonePe, and RazorPay.
  • Startups are pivotal to India's economic landscape and employment opportunities.
  • These unicorns are recognized for leveraging technology and disruptive models.
“As India’s startup ecosystem continues to expand, it reflects the vital role these ventures play in shaping the future of the country’s economy.”

The list demonstrates not only high valuations but the impact these companies have on the economy and employment in India.

item.title: Reliance Industries Q3 FY25 results preview: Net profit seen up 6%, margin expansion expected - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Reliance Industries Q3 FY25 results preview: Net profit seen up 6%, margin expansion expected

Date: January 16, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Reliance Industries is set to post a 6% sequential growth in Q3 net profit to Rs 17,482 crore, driven by stronger refining margins and higher ARPU in digital services.

  • Expected Q3 net profit of Rs 17,482 crore.
  • Estimated EBITDA of Rs 41,125 crore, reflecting a 5% quarter-on-quarter growth.
  • Improvement in EBITDA margin estimated between 18.2% and 18.9%.
  • Mixed performance anticipated, with strong telecom earnings and refining margins offsetting weaknesses in petrochemicals.
“RIL’s Q3 results are expected to be supported by robust growth in telecom and refining margins, despite challenges in the retail sector.”

Overall, RIL's Q3 FY25 results are expected to reflect strong earnings growth amidst a challenging market environment.

item.title: IRFC, RVNL, Ircon, other railway stocks surge as govt may increase rail budget by 18% in FY26 - Moneycontrol
item.description:
IRFC, RVNL, Ircon, other railway stocks surge as govt may increase rail budget by 18% in FY26

Date: January 16, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Railway stocks have rebounded strongly in response to reports of a potential significant increase in the railway budget for FY26, leading to improved investor sentiment.

  • Government may increase the rail budget allocation by 15-18% for FY26.
  • Expected allocation of Rs 2.9-3 lakh crore for gross budgetary support for Indian Railways.
  • Focus on enhancing railway infrastructure and production of Vande Bharat trains.
  • IRFC shares surged 11.45% while RVNL and Railtel Corporation gained 11.66% and 8.77% respectively.
“The anticipated increase has boosted investor sentiment, reversing the downward trend seen in recent months.”

This expected budget increase indicates strong governmental support for rail infrastructure development, promising positive growth in the sector.

item.title: Exclusive | India may revive RINL steel plant with ₹10,000 crore plan - CNBCTV18
item.description:
India Plans ₹10,000 Crore Revival for RINL Steel Plant

Date: January 16, 2024 | Source: CNBC-TV18

The Government of India is set to propose a ₹10,000 crore financial package to revive the Rashtriya Ispat Nigam Limited (RINL) steel plant, aimed at addressing its financial distress and operational challenges.

  • The Cabinet is expected to discuss the revival plan in its upcoming meeting.
  • RINL has significant liabilities of approximately ₹35,000 crore.
  • The financial aid aims to stabilize the operations of RINL, crucial for India’s steel production.
  • Steel Secretary Sandeep Poundrik confirmed ongoing discussions about the proposal.
“The revival plan is seen as a critical move to stabilize RINL, which has been grappling with financial distress.” - Steel Secretary Sandeep Poundrik

This revival is considered essential not just for RINL but for the broader steel industry in India, which faces ongoing challenges from debt and operational inefficiencies.

item.title: Kalyan Jewellers shares wipe off Rs 27,400 crore wealth in 2 weeks - The Economic Times
item.description:
Kalyan Jewellers Faces Major Share Selloff, Losing Rs 27,400 Crore in Two Weeks

Date: Not provided
Source: ETMarkets.com

Kalyan Jewellers' shares have experienced a steep decline, wiping off Rs 27,400 crore in market value in just two weeks. Despite reporting significant revenue growth, investor sentiment remains negative amidst speculation and a series of share price drops.

  • Kalyan Jewellers shares fell 6.7% to Rs 518.40 on BSE after an 8% drop the previous day.
  • The stock has declined 33.7% over two weeks, marking the ninth decline in ten trading sessions.
  • The company's market capitalization is currently Rs 53,949.23 crore.
  • Executive Director Ramesh Kalyanaraman denies bribery allegations as “absurd.”
  • The company reported a 39% revenue growth in the last quarter, driven by festive and wedding demand.
  • Analysts remain optimistic, with all eight recommending a 'buy' with a target price of Rs 761.
“The company has no plans to purchase any aircraft and currently operates a helicopter.” - Ramesh Kalyanaraman

In conclusion, the substantial selloff raises concerns about Kalyan Jewellers' future, despite positive quarterly results and strong growth prospects.

item.title: 'Kitne Ghazi Aaye, Kitne Ghazi…’: Adani Group CFO shares cryptic post after Hindenburg Research announces - The Times of India
item.description:
‘Kitne Ghazi Aaye, Kitne Ghazi…’: Adani Group CFO shares cryptic post after Hindenburg Research announces shutdown

Publication Date: Unknown Source: Unknown

In a recent cryptic social media post, the CFO of the Adani Group alluded to the challenges posed by Hindenburg Research, which has announced its decision to shut down operations.

  • The post references historical battles and strategies, prompting speculation about its implications.
  • Hindenburg Research gained notoriety for its critical assessments of the Adani Group in the past.
“Our strength lies in not just facing challenges but learning from them.”

This development marks a turning point in the ongoing discourse surrounding corporate accountability and market practices.

item.title: Reliance share price gains ahead of Q3 results today. Buy or sell? | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Reliance Share Price Gains Ahead of Q3 Results: Buy or Sell?

Date: January 16, 2025 | Source: Live Mint

Reliance Industries share price gained on Thursday ahead of the announcement of its earnings for the third quarter of FY25, rising nearly 1% to ₹1,264.30 apiece on the BSE.

RIL is estimated to post strong earnings growth in the telecom business Jio, improvements in refining margins, and modest growth in the retail business. However, its oil-to-chemical segment may show muted earnings.

Key Points:

  • Reliance share price rose by nearly 1% ahead of Q3 results.
  • Expectations for mixed performance, with strong telecom earnings but muted oil-to-chemical results.
  • Analysts suggest a trend reversal based on recent stock performance.
  • Shares have fallen 20% in six months and over 8% in one year.
“Reliance shares are in a corrective downtrend... attempting a trend reversal.” - Milan Vaishnav, CMT, MSTA

Conclusion: Investors are advised to consider holding existing shares and potentially entering at the current price for medium-term gains.

item.title: Dalmia Bharat, Shree Renuka Sugars to Triveni Eng: Why sugar stocks are skyrocketing today? | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Why Sugar Stocks Are Skyrocketing: Insights from Dalmia Bharat and Shree Renuka Sugars

Date: January 16, 2023 | Source: Live Mint

Sugar stocks are experiencing a significant rise today due to anticipated increases in ethanol prices, with Dalmia Bharat, Shree Renuka Sugars, and Triveni Engineering leading the market.

  • Dalmia Bharat shares are up 1%, trading at ₹1,758.
  • Shree Renuka Sugars stock rose nearly 4%, reaching an intraday high of ₹38.18.
  • Triveni Engineering also saw an increase of 3%, trading at ₹411.40.
  • Other notable gains included Bajaj Hindusthan Sugar Ltd., which increased by 3.87%.

The Union Cabinet is expected to approve an increase in ethanol prices, impacting sugar prices positively. Union Minister Nitin Gadkari emphasized the goal of achieving 20% ethanol blending in the near future.

“We will achieve this target of 20 per cent ethanol blending in the next two months. The use of E20 will help in reducing pollution,” said Union Minister Nitin Gadkari.

The ethanol blending initiative is projected to significantly lower carbon emissions and reduce India's dependence on oil imports, benefiting both the environment and the economy.

Market analysts predict a continued upward trend in sugar stock prices as investors respond to the anticipated changes in government policy.

item.title: Sensex off day's highs, Nifty below 23,350 as FMCG, pharma stocks fall; Adani shares gain - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Sensex off day's highs, Nifty below 23,350 as FMCG, pharma stocks fall; Adani shares gain

Date: January 16, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Benchmark indices Nifty and Sensex continued to trade in the positive, albeit off highs, despite a selloff in FMCG and pharma stocks. Meanwhile, Adani Group stocks rallied after the disbandment of Hindenburg Research.

  • Sensex was up 261.44 points or 0.34 percent at 76,985.52.
  • Nifty was up 85.95 points or 0.37 percent at 23,299.15.
  • Adani stocks rebounded following the end of scrutiny from Hindenburg Research.
  • Positive US inflation data for December boosted investor sentiment globally.
“Markets continued their upward momentum for the third consecutive session.”

This market behavior indicates a cautious tone in defensive sectors like FMCG and pharma, while some recovery in Adani shares points to changing investor sentiments.

item.title: Reliance Jio Q3 Preview: Strong growth likely as each user contributed ₹10 more to revenue after tariff hikes - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Reliance Jio Q3 Preview: Strong Growth Expected Post Tariff Hikes

Date: January 16, 2024 | Source: CNBC-TV18

The article discusses the anticipated strong growth of Reliance Jio for Q3 FY25, attributed to recent tariff hikes.

  • Analysts predict a 4.8% increase in revenue, reaching ₹29,709 crore.
  • Quarterly profit after tax is expected to be ₹6,884 crore, a 10.5% increase from the previous quarter.
  • The average revenue per user (ARPU) is projected to rise to ₹205.
  • Subscriber recovery is anticipated, with expectations of reaching approximately 485 million users.
  • Reliance Industries' stock has seen a decline of about 9% over the past year.
“Tariff hikes typically take two to three quarters for complete flow through.”

The market remains optimistic about Reliance Jio’s growth prospects as the effects of the tariff hikes unfold.

item.title: MC Exclusive: Apple finally breaks into India’s top 5 smartphone brands with record market share - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Apple Breaks into India's Top 5 Smartphone Brands with Record Market Share

Date: January 16, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The unstoppable ascent of Apple in India reaches a new milestone. For the first time, Apple has broken into India's top five smartphone brands, achieving a remarkable 9–10% market share during the festive September–December period of 2024.

  • Apple achieved a historic market share of 9–10% during the September-December 2024 period.
  • This marks Apple's first entry into the top five smartphone brands in India since launching iPhones.
  • Promotions like festive discounts and no-cost EMIs boosted sales significantly.
  • Older-generation models, particularly the iPhone 15 and iPhone 13, played a key role in this growth.
  • IDC research director Upasana Joshi noted that e-tailer deals contributed to high growth for Apple over the year.
“Apple set a record by entering the top five vendor list for the Indian smartphone market in Q4 2024 with a market share exceeding 9%.” - Upasana Joshi, Research Director at IDC

This achievement reflects Apple's increasing popularity and strategic marketing efforts in the Indian smartphone market.

item.title: JP Morgan bullish on Indian Q-commerce, predicts upside potential up to 50% for Zomato, Swiggy - The Economic Times
item.description:
JP Morgan bullish on Indian Q-commerce, predicts upside potential up to 50% for Zomato, Swiggy

Publication Date: Not specified Source: The Economic Times

Global brokerage firm JP Morgan has expressed confidence in the Indian Quick Commerce (Q-Commerce) sector by maintaining 'Overweight' ratings on Zomato and Swiggy, projecting significant share price increases.

  • JP Morgan suggests Swiggy has a potential upside of 50%, while Zomato could see a 39.4% increase.
  • Key players are significantly expanding their dark store networks, with Blinkit exceeding 1,000 stores and Zepto over 700 stores as of Q3 2024.
  • Both companies are strategically focusing on penetrating smaller markets through new store additions.
  • Looking to 2025, all major players are expected to add over 200 new dark stores.
“Zomato's Quick Commerce Profit & Loss (P&L) is well-positioned to absorb further growth without significantly impacting contribution margin and EBITDA.”

This expansion reflects JP Morgan’s confidence in the quick commerce market growth in India, highlighting substantial opportunities beyond major cities.

item.title: Hyundai Creta Electric Review: Long-Awaited EV Is Familiar And Feature-Loaded - NDTV
item.description:
Hyundai Creta Electric Review: Long-Awaited EV Is Familiar And Feature-Loaded

Publication Date: Not specified Source: NDTV

The new Hyundai Creta Electric combines familiarity with modern electric features, promising impressive range and performance.

  • Powered by a 51.4 kWh battery, the Creta EV offers a range of 473 km on a single charge.
  • Performance is impressive, achieving 0-100 km/h in just 7.9 seconds.
  • Retains the driving dynamics of the internal combustion engine version, with improved ride comfort.
  • Features such as lane keep assist, blind spot monitoring, and various driving modes enhance the driving experience.
  • Charging capabilities include 11 kW AC wallbox charging and 50 kW DC fast charging.
  • Interior is feature-rich, with dual 10.25-inch screens and premium materials.
  • Offers vehicle-to-load functionality for powering external devices.
“Creta Electric is typically a Hyundai: Feature-loaded, familiar and family-oriented.”

In conclusion, while the Creta Electric offers many comforts and features, it may lack the 'wow' factor, with pricing being a crucial factor for potential buyers.

item.title: Bengaluru sees 81% drop in luxury housing sales: CBRE - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Bengaluru Experiences Significant Decline in Luxury Housing Sales

Publication Date: January 16, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Bengaluru, known for its IT sector, has registered an astonishing 81% drop in luxury housing sales priced at ₹4 crore and above, according to a recent CBRE report.

  • Only 50 luxury housing units sold in Bengaluru in 2023, compared to 265 units in 2022.
  • The broader market for the top 7 cities saw a 53% increase in luxury unit sales.
  • During the first half of 2024, only 10 luxury units sold, down from 200 in the same period last year.
“The demand for luxury housing in Bengaluru remains resilient, driven by the city's expanding base of high-net-worth individuals (HNIs) and expatriates.” - Anshuman Magazine, CBRE

Despite the significant drop in sales, experts highlight that the demand from affluent buyers remains strong, primarily due to the lack of new luxury housing launches amidst rising costs.

item.title: ‘India Has Missed the GenAI Bus and No Amount of Funds Can Cover it’ - AIM
item.description:
‘India Has Missed the GenAI Bus and No Amount of Funds Can Cover it’

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Analytics India Magazine

India is struggling to catch up in the generative AI landscape dominated by global players despite significant investment.

  • India raised $11.3 billion in tech funding in 2024, significantly less than the West’s $184 billion.
  • HCLTech aims to implement AI services for 100 clients by FY26. The cost of using LLMs has dropped 85% since early 2023.
  • Experts highlight that India lacks foundational research in crucial AI technologies.
  • Predictions suggest India may have around 100 AI unicorns in the next decade, but funding remains drastically lower than international counterparts.
  • Calls for increasing government investment in AI research have been made, advocating for a shift from short-term gains to long-term innovation.
“The pace of AI progress is so rapid that we simply cannot catch up by relying on engineers and researchers alone.”

In conclusion, unless India enhances its investment and shifts focus towards foundational AI research, it risks falling further behind in the global AI race.
